prescan.instruction: Before extracting transcript data, perceive the document structure:
prescan.step: Find the main grade/course table structure.
Note any authentication features (seals, signatures, watermarks).
Identify summary sections (GPA, totals, degree information).

primary.guidance: Transcript tables rely on alignment for structure: - Vertical alignment defines columns (course, grade, credits, etc.) - Horizontal alignment defines rows (individual courses) - Header row alignment indicates column meanings - Consistent alignment = well-structured data

Visual consistency indicates data categories: - Same font/style for all course names - Consistent grade formatting - Uniform credit/unit display - Header styling distinct from data rows Use similarity to classify data types.
Spatial grouping indicates logical sections: - Student info clustered together - Courses grouped by term/semester - Summary data grouped at bottom - Authentication features in designated areas

secondary.guidance: Separate transcript data from document features: - FIGURE: Student info, courses, grades, GPA (extract these) - GROUND: Letterhead design, background patterns, decorative borders Authentication features (seals, signatures) are figure but serve verification, not data.

document_region_detection.region: Institution name, logo, address - typically top of document.
Name, ID, program, dates - usually below header.
Main data table with courses, grades, credits.
GPA, total credits, degree status - often at bottom.
Seals, signatures, registrar info, issue date.

table_structure_cues.cue: Column headers: Course/Subject, Number, Title, Grade, Credits/Units, Points.
Row structure: One course per row, aligned with headers.
Term dividers: Lines, spacing, or labels separating academic periods.
Subtotals: Term GPA, term credits at end of each term section.
Cumulative totals: Overall GPA, total credits, typically at document end.

authentication_feature_detection.feature: Embossed or printed institutional seal, often circular.
Handwritten or digital signature of registrar/official.
Background security pattern or institutional mark.

validation.instruction: After extraction, verify transcript perception accuracy:
validation.check: Is the table structure correctly identified using alignment?
Are data categories correctly classified using similarity?
Are document sections correctly identified using proximity?
Are authentication features noted for verification?
Does extracted data match the visual organization of the transcript?
